word: A humble house of worship must be built there. This work must be done in every city where camp meetings are held. If we cannot secure a house of worship, where those who accept unpopular truths can assemble, we might better not enter new places; for the ministers work under the inspiration of the enemy to counter the work of Seventh-day Adventists.--Letter 140, 1898, pp. 7, 8. (To Dr. J. H. Kellogg, December 20, 1898.)
